intro: Conophyllum cognatum, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its bark and wood are valued for their aromatic properties and have been used in traditional medicine. Conophyllum cognatum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
